intro: Verticordia habrantha, commonly known as the red-stemmed featherflower, is a species of flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, feathery inflorescences. The plant typically grows in sandy soils and is often found in heathlands and woodlands. Its flowers are usually pink to red in color, and it blooms during the cooler months. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
